title: Caravans of Fortune
desc: Initially I used Love2D to create this game, but it was taking too long so I shifted to Unity! This is a trading game I started making in January 2025, after an inspiration I took while attending a friend`s LAN party, one of my buddies was playing Balatro, I wanted to make a game where you are rewarded for combining things, but I also wanted the game to be realistic, thus I made a game that`s set in the days of old Silk Road. In this game you must meet your gold target otherwise you lose, and you gain gold through buying & combining items or treasures. Avoid bandits all time!

title: CaloriesJack
desc: CaloriesJack is a competitive calorie-tracking challenge where players try to reach a target calorie goal without exceeding it. Each player chooses a food item which is tallied at the end. Those closest to the goal are declared the winners. Game is hosted on Vercel & Render (Frontend & Backend) and uses Supabase for Database (PostgreSQL)

title: My Website
desc: My website that you are currently on, wanted to showcase all my projects I worked on in the past. (Pictures may or may not be the same as the current site).

title: QuizMinaret
desc: A quiz app made using React Native for those who are Muslim or non Muslims seeking more knowledge in Islam or for those who want to test their knowledge in Islam, the quiz is divided into 3 major sections: Islamic foundation, practices and history and each section includes 100 questions as of now

title: Top Ten Games Site
desc: Along with a friend who worked on the backend, I’ve developed a dynamic web application for managing a personal list of top ten games, enabling users to add, edit, and delete game entries. The project involved building a user authentication system, implementing a responsive user interface, and connecting to a back-end API to fetch and update game data. It also featured real-time updates for added games and an efficient loading screen during data retrieval.

title: Capstone Conestoga Hub
desc: During my Computer Application Development program at Conestoga College, I was given an opportunity to work with a team of 4 on a capstone, we’ve decided to create a website called “Conestoga Hub” which is basically a platform to allow college students to collaborate with each other through creating forms/posts and provides a small library of articles which has convenient access to important information for students at Conestoga College.

title: 2D IT Simulator
desc: Unity game I made that involves UI elements such as buttons and panels. The game was inspired while working as IT (tried to demonstrate part of my IT work in the form of a game to give insights to those who know nothing of IT how some of IT work would look like!). The objective is to avoid receiving 3 strikes from your boss (by ensuring you complete all tickets according to description)

title: CaveCrawlers
desc:
Unity game I made back in 2020, the premise of the game is to survive as long as you can in this endless dungeon where monsters randomly lurk in the tiles you see from screenshots, the game involves
• Combat system is purely based on timing your attacks at landing the “sword” at the orange or red part (please see the next slide for reference of the combat)
•Fighting monsters randomly spawned in tiles
•Gaining loot from monsters (weapons you can sell or use)
•Random chests are spawned that contain potion upgrades or potions
•At a randomly chosen tile, there is a boss where if fought and defeated you advance to next level.
•Random shops appear in each level where you can purchase from 3 randomly chosen items (can be potions or weapons)
•Charge up your attack (Lightning bolt) that instantly defeats any monster (or deals great damage to a boss)

title: Farm Tiles
desc: Unity game I made back in 2019 that is entirely made of buttons! The premise of the game is to farm crops & sell them, then buy more crops and repeat the cycle. This was one of my very first Unity projects I made and wanted to test the performance of using buttons.

title: Athan Notifier
desc: another chrome extension that showcases the different prayer times according to geographic location and displays a daily hadith (sayings of the prophet Muhammad peace be upon him) on the bottom of it (made it because I wanted to quickly check time for prayers rather than check a site that sometimes is down at random times)

title: TrackLife
desc: a chrome extension quickly made to track browsing history and display it into a pi chart for the user to be aware of what sites they visit mostly (made it because I had bad time management and I previously used majority of my time on social media)
